intro: Lomatogonium lloydioides, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces vibrant blue or purple flowers that bloom in the early morning. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water requirements. Its rapid growth and ability to thrive in poor soils make it a common weed in disturbed areas.
